Fields.DialogueText: Has anyone seen Salmon? I've been looking everywhere for her...
Did somebody call for me?
There you are. Where did you come from? Why are you wet?
I was just out for a little swim. The water is deliciously cool.
We're in a submarine. Underwater. Care to explain?
Captain, I'm a Belle. I can make myself incorporeal. See?
Yes, I know. I was more perplexed by why you would feel the need to go underwater yourself, when you, the submarine, are already underwater.

Fields.MenuText: Also, stop phasing in and out of the submarine. You're freaking me out.
You've got to teach me how to do that. It looks like fun.
If you're done swimming, I needed to talk to you.

Fields.DialogueText: My apologies, Captain. Was there something you needed?
Well, if you become a Belle, I'd be more than happy to.
Yes, what did you need, Captain?
*ALARM*
Never mind. We've got bigger things to worry about.
Let's go to it, Captain!
@BATTLE
So, Captain, you wanted to speak to me about something earlier, didn't you? What was it?
I was hoping to discuss strategy with you. Command has given us fairly free rein at the moment, and I want to make sure we make the most of it.
I agree completely. How would you like to move forward?

Fields.MenuText: I think we should pinpoint key ships and target them first.
I... have honestly no idea...
We should head to areas with the highest concentration of Morganas and wipe out as many as we can.

Fields.DialogueText: That is a valid strategy.
None whatsoever? It's a good thing I'm here, then.
That could work. But we'd likely meet our end in the process.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm. You wouldn't happen to have a strategy ready for this fight, would you?
Captain, Captain... you have much to learn.
@BATTLE
It's not enough though, is it? We can't forget that the Morganas aren't stupid. They're probably planning too.
Yes. We'll just need to plan two steps ahead of them. Three for good measure.
Yes, a very good thing. You're not just our secret weapon on the battlefield, but also in the strategy room.
Oh, Captain, you're just flattering me now.
Well, I'm open to suggestions, if you have any.
I have plenty, and none of them end with our defeat.
All right, so this will be our strategy going forward?
Yes, I think it'll be our best move.
Of course, we should continue to meet every once in a while to make sure no changes need to be made.

Fields.MenuText: Changes? Like what?
I agree. The tides of war can be fickle.
If you think that's for the best, then I'm not going to argue.

Fields.DialogueText: The Morganas could get stronger, our forces could get weaker, sickness, mutiny, hunger, death...
Yes, and it's always best to plan for the unexpected.
You're smarter than you look, Captain.
Either way, thanks for the help. The Morganas better start running scared.
Well, they're not. I can sense a few of them to the east. And they're not the least bit afraid.
We'll change that.
@BATTLE
I get it, lots of bad stuff.
Sorry about that, Captain, but it's better to think about these things before they happen, rather than after.
I'm lucky you're here, thinking so far ahead.
If I didn't, panic would take the ship if, and when, disaster struck.
I'm going to choose to take that as a compliment.
See, I was right. Smart.
Salmon... what are you doing up there?
Oh, hullo, Captain. I'm just watching the crew.
From the ceiling?
There's not a lot of room, and people don't usually notice me up here. I'm actually surprised you did.

Fields.MenuText: Your outfit is a little too bright to blend in with the ship.
I almost missed you, but I heard you chewing.
Are you trying to hide or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not trying to hide or anything. People just rarely look up in a submarine. There's not much to see.
Yeah, I've been snacking. Want a hazelnut?
No, I just don't want people to notice me while I'm watching them.
Is there a reason you're spying on the crew?
No, it's just what I do when I'm snacking. It's fun.
Maybe I can join you sometime.
Maybe, but not right now. I can sense a Morgana nearby. And I think she's headed our way.
@BATTLE
At least, not usually.
No, thanks. I'm good.
That's a little creepy, Salmon.
Is Salmon swimming again?
I think so. I'm pretty sure I saw her dive through the wall a while ago.
Great.

Fields.MenuText: Salmon! I need you!
I guess it can wait until later.
No wonder her name is Salmon, she sure swims like one.

Fields.DialogueText: No need to shout, Captain. What is it?
Did I hear my name?
Excuse me, I swim better than one.
Can you bring your entire body back in, please? It's disconcerting talking to a disembodied head.
Sure.
Sorry, I'm getting everything all wet. What did you need?
We're going to need to make port and resupply soon. I was hoping you could help me chart out a safe path.
Of course, it'd be my pleasure.
Do you have time now?
No, and neither do you. I'm sensing a handful of Morganas making their way towards us from the north.
So what you're saying is we shouldn't head north for port.
Maybe after we run off these Morganas?
@BATTLE
How are we on supplies?
The real worry is fresh water. Given the problems we had with the reserve supply, we have enough for the trip back to port, but just barely.
So as long as we don't come across any skirmishes, we should be golden.
Do you think we'll be able to avoid the Morganas?
There's no way to know for certain. You really waited until the last minute to return to port.

Fields.MenuText: I know. I wasn't planning for contaminants, and I underestimated the problem. If there's a next time I'll get it right.
Lesson learned. All knowledge comes from mistakes.
This is war. We have to make the most of what we have.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be there to make sure you do.
You've only ever gained knowledge from your mistakes? Not much of a reader, are you, Captain?
This might be war, but that's all the more reason to abstain from risk taking. Especially when you could be wagering the lives of your crew.
I'm glad you're here to lecture me. Honestly. You keep my head straight.
You seem a little worried, Captain.
Captain, we're picking up hostiles to the west. They're coming right for us.
Should we run, or can we afford to take them on?
... If we make it quick. Go to it!
@BATTLE
What are you doing out here, Salmon?
Enjoying a breath of fresh air. The submarine can get a little stuffy, especially after a battle.
In case you haven't noticed, you're standing in the middle of a massive storm.
You call this massive? This isn't anything I haven't seen before.

Fields.MenuText: At least put on a raincoat or something. You don't want to catch a cold.
Well, don't come crying to me if you catch a cold.
Do you just like getting wet or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be fine. I spend the majority of my time underwater. A little rain hardly phases me.
I don't cry. And I don't catch cold.
It's refreshing. A little rain has never hurt anyone.
All right, if you're so sure you can handle yourself, I'll leave you to it.
Thank you, Captain. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to enjoy this as much as I can before the storm passes.
@BATTLE
Captain? Do you have a minute?
Sure. What can I do for you?
Authorize me to take a few hours to take stock? I'd like to double-check how our rations and basic supplies are holding up.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure our supplies are fine. It's time we get back out there.
Be my guest, an extra set of eyes are always welcome.
Actually, I was about to ask you to do exactly that.

Fields.DialogueText: And we will, but first I'm going to make sure we don't cut it as close as we did last time.
Mine especially. They never miss a thing.
Great minds and all that.
Is this the manifest? It certainly looks like we're full.
This is food, right?
Twice as much as we had before. Same for blankets, clothing. Solder. Everything we could grab last time we were at port.
Hmmm... I see...
Is that an "I see" of approval?
It'll do. We'll discuss timetables during our next meeting.
Sounds like a plan. Now how about we find a Morgana and use some of our new ammunition?
As long as we don't rush into anything, Captain.
@BATTLE
Hey, Salmon, I've been meaning to ask, what are all those badges on your coat for?
Oh, these? These are my Girl Guide badges.
This one is for Community Safety, this one is my Life Saver badge, and this one is my Swimmer badge.

Fields.MenuText: What's a Girl Guide?
Oh, you're a Girl Guide. That's... kind of surprising.
Community Safety badge? That's one of the stupidest things I've ever heard of.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a group for girls that aids them in their development into constructive women in society.
Why? Are you saying I'm not Girl Guide material?
I'll have you know that the Community Safety badge is a very important badge. Earning it prepared me to protect our current community - this ship.
... How did a ship earn Girl Guide badges...?
@BATTLE
Oh, that does sound familiar.
Yeah, there are lots of groups, all over the place. Some for girls, some for boys, some for both.
Oh, that's the alarm. Looks like we've got some trouble to deal with.
Let's go to it!
No, I'm just saying... you... you know, you're a Belle.
... What are you trying to say?
Oh, that's the alarm. Looks like we've got some trouble to deal with.
I know you're just trying to change the subject, but the Morganas are more important.
Okay, I'm sorry, you're right. I'm very glad you know how to keep us safe.
Good. Because I also know how to keep us unsafe.
Oh, that's the alarm. Looks like we've got some trouble to deal with.
Step one to keeping this community safe? Defeat any Morganas that get too close.
Crew watching again, Salmon?
Got to do something while I'm eating. Hazelnut?
Don't mind if I do.
So how does this work?
It's pretty easy. I just take what I know about everyone, watch what they're doing and fill in the blanks.
All right...
I'll give you an example. See him, I overheard him talking about how he was starving earlier, but he's yet to get any food. Instead he's talking to that woman.
So what would you deduce?

Fields.MenuText: He was exaggerating earlier, and isn't actually that hungry.
He obviously has a crush on her.
... This isn't working. Can I have another hazelnut?

Fields.DialogueText: I guess that could be possible, but I think it's more likely he has a crush. Or perhaps they're in a secret relationship.
That, or maybe they're actually in a secret relationship.
No. You have to try harder. It's not that hard to see that there are romantic inclinations there.
Captain, Salmon, we have Morganas heading our way.
Can you create a story for the Morganas?
They're too twisted even for me to figure out.
@BATTLE
Not possible. I'm pretty sure he's in a serious relationship. He's got someone waiting for him back home.
Really? You're sure? Dang. Well, that's why I like doing this. You can come up with any story, they don't necessarily have to be right.
A secret relationship? You've got a scandalous mind, Salmon.
Maybe, but it's all in good fun. It's just a game after all.
It's just a hazelnut. Calm down.
Not the hazelnut, the game.
Captain, we just got word from your contact in Italy.
Excellent, will they be able to send aid our way?
Actually, it seems like the opposite.
They're in trouble?
Apparently the Mediterranean has attracted the attention of more Morganas than we realized.
Do we have numbers?
No, but it's enough that they're requesting our help thinning the herd, as it were.

Fields.MenuText: We should hurry there. If we help now they'll owe us a favor.
It sounds like a good chance to give the Morganas what for.
Maybe I should think about this first. It's an important decision.

Fields.DialogueText: Smart thinking, Captain. We'll change course immediately.
Maybe you should talk to Salmon about this first before making any decisions?
It is, but we should send word back to them soon, Captain.
Captain, I can sense a group of Morganas nearby. They're speeding towards us.
Sound the alarm. Get the crew ready for a fight.
@BATTLE
Quick question.
Go ahead.
Where are we right now, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: What's with the scowl?
I believe we're somewhere in the Mediterranean.
My office. In a submarine. In the ocean. On earth.

Fields.DialogueText: I wanted to go swimming, get a little exercise in. But the water is too warm. It's horrible.
That explains the water temperature. It's uncomfortably hot.
Very funny. I just wanted to know why the water outside is so warm.
How long until we're somewhere cooler? Like the Atlantic.
It might take a little time. We've picked up on several nearby Morganas, and I want to take on as many as we can before it's time to resupply.
I thought we agreed on a different strategy, Captain.
Yes, but this opportunity came up and I made a decision.
I understand.  Give me a moment to gather my thoughts and we can discuss our plans moving forward.
That sounds... good. I was worried you'd be angry with me.
Oh, angry? Why on earth would I be angry?
That tone leads me to believe that's a rhetorical question.
Mhmmmm.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm.
Maybe because we just headed blindly into an area filled with Morganas.
You sound a little stressed, maybe after this battle you can go for a swim.
It's too warm!
@BATTLE
We're surrounded on all sides by Morganas.
My contact in Italy wasn't kidding. They really are everywhere.
Getting into a fight with one of them seems to draw every Morgana nearby into the battle, and to make matters worse, the water is warm.

Fields.MenuText: So what would you have us do, Salmon?
At least we're doing good on supplies.
That just means more Morganas to defeat.

Fields.DialogueText: If it was up to me, we wouldn't be in this situation in the first place.
Bravo, you managed to listen to me that time.
Don't get ahead of yourself. Underestimating your enemy is a surefire path to defeat.
I'm getting the feeling that you just want us to turn tail and run.
We'd no doubt attract the attention of the Morganas, and if too many of them catch our scent, even I wouldn't be able to handle them.
So we stay and fight?
Group by group until eventually we're out of supplies and forced to run anyway? Only a slightly better option.
We have a responsibility to the people here in the Mediterranean, to protect them from the Morganas.
And based on the sounds I'm hearing, the Morganas aren't willing to give us much time to make up our minds on the subject.
Of course not. It's time to go to it! Let's make this fast and quiet. We don't want to attract too much attention.
@BATTLE
Hey, Salmon, you still all worried, thinking about our next step?
The Mediterranean is still swarming with Morganas. Someone needs to think about what we'll do next.

Fields.MenuText: You know, you're a bit of a nervous talker.
We're doing fine so far, aren't we?
I appreciate you putting so much work into this. Any way I can help?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not nerves. I'm just stressed. Understandably so, given the circumstances.
For now. Just wait until the next fight, or five seconds after that during the next, next fight, or ten seconds later during the fight, after the fight, after that.
There's always a way to help. For instance you could help me figure out where the most powerful Morgana is.
Hold it... there's a group of Morganas heading for us. Larger than normal.
It's hardly a surprise anymore.
@BATTLE
I'm guessing I'm not exactly helping with the stress right now?
Kind of. Talking to you is helping with my stress, but your side of the conversation isn't exactly useful to me.
I can work on that.
I get it, lots of fighting coming. It's just that unlike you, I think we can take it.
You can keep thinking that. And when the submarine is taking on water and the crew is taking their final breaths, I'll be able to say "I told you so."
You can get pretty dark, Salmon.
I can do that.
And then help me develop a plan to take her down without the rest of the Morganas coming to her aid.
That's the hard part.
It looks like we can finally take a moment to catch our breath.
If my information is right we should be safe here for a while.
But... well, it won't surprise you to hear me say we shouldn't get comfortable.

Fields.MenuText: You're right, we should still spend our time developing a strategy to deal with these Morganas.
If we're not going to get comfortable, then we might as well leave.
Then what should we do, Salmon?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe I've already thought of a plan. I just need a little more time to iron out the details.
I suppose you have a point. Get comfortable, just be ready to leave or fight at a moment's notice.
... I don't have all the answers. Yet. I just know what I'm going to do.
I need to start charting our route, seeing if there's some strategic way of dealing with these Morganas.
If you want to help, you can bring me a cartographer, or at least someone familiar with the area.
I'll get right on that.
Well, first we might have to deal with some company.
Already? I thought this place would be safe.
So did I. It doesn't seem like a large group. If we can dispatch them hastily, we should be safe here for a few moments longer.
Then we better get ready.
@BATTLE
Care to share those details with me, your captain?
I always am. It's a perk of fighting in this war.
Which is?
So if we lure a large group this way, and then quickly double back, we can funnel them through here, correct?
Hmmm... I guess it could work... If any of them followed us, it'd be a much smaller number.
A horde wouldn't be able to fit through the narrow passage...
And what do you expect we'd find on the other side?
I'm guessing that's where they're coming from... some kind of nest? A headquarters of some sort? No doubt a powerful force will be waiting us.
My thoughts as well.

Fields.MenuText: So all we'd need to do is defeat that force and the rest of the Morganas should begin to disperse, right?
So we escape through this passage and get sandwiched between two huge groups of Morganas? Great plan, Salmon.
... I'm lost. Is this the Pacific?

Fields.DialogueText: Hopefully. It's our best plan at this point. And it offers a possible means of escape if we get over our heads.
I'm doing the best with the situation you've put us in, Captain.
It's the Mediterranean. Stop acting like such a buffoon and take this seriously.
How soon can we be prepared to move?
A couple hours if we're not forced to stay on the move. Twice as long if we're continuously set upon by Morganas.
I'll work on a hiding spot.
*ALARM*
If that alarm is any indication, then this isn't much of one.
At least we managed to come up with a plan. Go to it! Let's get ready for a few more Morganas.
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain. Any news?
Nothing you wouldn't already know. The crew is getting prepared for your plan, Salmon. What are you doing?
I'm stress-eating.

Fields.MenuText: Can I have a hazelnut?
I'm sorry I got us in this situation. I should've checked with you first.
You've been pretty stressed lately. Want to talk about it?

Fields.DialogueText: No. They're all mine this time.
I don't even know why you didn't. I'm clearly the superior strategist, if this situation is any indication.
Seriously? Like you don't know why I'm stressed?
Could you leave me alone right now? I'm trying to relax here.
Watching the crew again? Sounds like fun.
Mhmmmm...
What about that guy over there? The way he's squirming, he clearly needs to use the head. Why do you think he's holding it?
It's not by choice. By my count, the stalls are full. I think there might be a bad case of food poisoning going around. Careful what you eat.
I'll keep that in mind.
... I'm still angry with you, you know.
I know... but I'm working on it.
Why bother?
I... you're a member of my crew. It doesn't do anyone any good if you hate me.
You make a good point. Hazelnut?
Save me one. It sounds like we've got a few Morganas to deal with.
@BATTLE
I think we're ready now, correct?
We're ready when you are. Give the word and we can start. Notice how I'm waiting for you to give the okay this time?
Yes, and I appreciate it, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: So time to start luring the Morganas in the wrong direction?
Time to head straight into the belly of the beast?
We're going to squeeze through the tight passage right?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I'm glad to see you were paying attention during our meetings.
Don't get ahead of yourself, we've got to lure off as many Morganas as we can, first.
Were you even paying attention? We need to lure the Morganas away first and then double back.
Mhmmmm, of course you did.
Salmon, Captain, we seem to be attracting the attention of a few Morganas.
Ah, so it starts.
Should we engage?
No, we run, but not fast enough to lose them. Right?
Right, we want to gather as large a force as we can. Still, we may have to face a few of them along the way.
I'm not worried. Not with you by my side.
Now you're just trying to flatter me.
@BATTLE
I always listen to you. Most of the time.
I know. I've just got my eye on the main goal.
I was paying attention. I just... thought we already did that part.
Well, we've had all the confirmation we could want.
There's a massive wall of Morganas on our tail, just like you wanted. Now what?
We turn around. Straight through them if we have to!

Fields.MenuText: You heard the lady, move!
We've taken a few hits, avoid the Morganas, but start heading back to the passage!
If you're positive. Turn around and don't let the Morganas stop us!

Fields.DialogueText: Double time!
That's probably for the best. I might've gotten a little ahead of myself. We don't want to sink here.
I wouldn't say it if I wasn't positive. Don't let anything stop us!
Are they giving chase still?
It looks like it, but they're not quite as fast as us. We should be able to put enough distance between us.
Salmon, we have a small group of Morganas at the entrance to the passage.
I guess we didn't lure them all off.
What do we do?
We only have one option, we have to dispatch them as fast as we can.
There are dozens of Morganas behind us. If we take the time to fight them we'll be surrounded before we know it.
That's why I said "as fast as we can." Go to it!
@BATTLE
I can't believe we made it through.
Honestly? Me neither. That was cutting it closer than I ever expected.
Are we at least safe here for now? Can we take some time to catch our breath?
No. The passage is tight, but it won't stop the Morganas from trickling through.
I understand.
Plus, if we don't hurry, though they'll gather around and trap us in here.
I get it.
If that happens it'll only be a matter of time before they wear us down and we're sleeping with the fishes...

Fields.MenuText: You're stress talking again, aren't you?
Salmon, you're starting to scare me. More than the Morganas breathing down our necks.
Sounds like you'd be at home, at least.

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, this time it's nerves. Definitely nerves.
I'm sorry, I'm not trying to, I'm just thinking aloud.
Oh, because my name is Salmon? Very funny, I've never heard that one before.
I'm sorry, I'm just thinking about what's waiting for us on the other side of this passage, and I'm imagining the worst.
Then let's get to the other side and see for ourselves.
First, we should take care of the few Morganas that have pursued us into the passage. It wouldn't do us any good to have a fight on both ends.
@BATTLE
Captain, I think we have eyes on the Morgana we're looking for. She doesn't look like one to be trifled with.
Really? Let me have a look.
Is it as bad as it sounds, Salmon?
It's certainly not good. But it isn't really any worse than I expected.

Fields.MenuText: Let me see.
Then there's no time to waste. Let's go.
Don't underestimate us, we haven't lost yet.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not so sure you want to do that. I think you'll be more confident in the fight to come if you didn't.
You took the words right out of my mouth.
Confidence is a good color on you, Captain.
Everyone, prepare for the hardest battle so far!
Go to it, all of you!
@BATTLE
I can still hardly believe we came out on top, Captain!
I knew we would, Salmon. I wasn't scared at all.
I'll pretend like I believe that.
Captain, we've got Morganas coming at us from every direction.
Salmon, I thought you said they'd thin out after we defeated the leader.
Give it a moment, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: In a moment we could be dead.
All right... I'm waiting.
And what's going to happen in a moment?

Fields.DialogueText: In that case, I'll offer my sincerest apologies.
*deep breath*
If I'm right, we'll celebrate. If I'm wrong... Just hope I'm not wrong.
... Captain, I think it worked. Most of them are turning away. It looks like they're having second thoughts.
Excellent work, Salmon.
Don't thank me yet. They didn't all turn away, we've still got incoming.
@BATTLE
How are we looking, Officer?
The Morganas have more or less disbanded, Captain. It seems they've lost any interest they might've had in the area.
So the Mediterranean is empty of Morganas?
Of course not, Captain. It's just not as thick with them as before. We've done all we can do here.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose you're right.
We could hunt down each and every individual Morgana.
I'm just glad we were able to provide some assistance.

Fields.DialogueText: You should get used to saying that, Captain. I have a feeling you'll be saying it a lot in the future.
Maybe... but that would be a poor use of our time when we could be doing other, more productive things with our time.
And now, when we need it, we'll hopefully be able to get some assistance of our own from your friends in Italy, right?
I'm thinking it's about time we left the Mediterranean. Don't you agree?
Yes, finally. Let's head somewhere a touch more frigid.
We shouldn't be too picky. We're running low on supplies again.
Fine. Any port in a storm, as they say.
@BATTLE
I suppose you're right.
Now you're getting it.
I see your point.
Exactly. Though, hopefully, we won't need their help any time soon.
Salmon, are you taking your coat off?
It's not against regulation, is it?
No. No, regulations for Belle dress are... um... pretty much absent. It's just a surprise.
You can't feel it?

Fields.MenuText: Feel what?
I guess it has gotten a little hotter...
The tension between you and me? All the time.

Fields.DialogueText: Since we got to the Mediterranean, the submarine has just gotten warmer and warmer.
A little? It's sweltering in here. I want to go out for a little swim, but the water's no better.
You mean that tension that makes me want to smack some sense into you occasionally? Yeah that too. But I was referring to the heat.
I'm just glad we're finally returning to the Pacific. I was starting to worry I'd be forced to walk around in my underwear before long.
Yeah that would be... horrible...
I'm sorry, what did you say?
Oh, nothing, uh, are those tattoos on your arms? They're interesting.
Yeah, it's a trail of scales. They actually lead up along my arms, down my back and end at my legs.
Sounds very complex.
I'll take that as a compliment.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm. You might want to grab your coat, it looks like we have Morganas headed our way.
They just don't know when to quit, do they?
@BATTLE
Salmon? What's up?
Is it true, Captain?
Are we finally out of the Atlantic?

Fields.MenuText: No, in fact, we're lost. Which way's up again?
Yes, we're officially back in the Pacific.
Oh, you wanted to leave? I thought we were on vacation.

Fields.DialogueText: Not the time for jokes, Captain. I just want to know if I can take a nice, relaxing swim...
Fantastic! I can't wait to jump in and feel the cold water surrounding me.
That was your idea of a vacation? A break from the water is the furthest thing from a vacation for me.
Well, I think it's safe for you to take a dip now. I'm sure the waters will be to your liking.
I can't wait, I'm going out right now! Just call if you need me, okay?
Sounds good, just don't forget Morganas could still show up any second.
I'm ready for anything, Captain.
Except... please can we avoid the Mediterranean from now on? Or, at least for a little while.

Fields.MenuText: No promises, Salmon. We go where we're needed.
For you? I think we can keep our distance for quite a while.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. Just... a little warning if we have to return would be appreciated.
Making special accommodations for me? If you keep that up, I'm going to think you're sweet on me, Captain.
